p: C-terminus elongation of the H protein due to single-point mutation at the stop codon have also been reported multiple times in SSPE cases [ 75, 133]. Contrarily to deletions of the cytoplasmic tail of H which were shown to enhance fusion activity [ 121], elongation of the extracellular domain of H seemed to impact binding, targeting, and may explain at least partially the high level of antibodies in SSPE cases [ 75, 133].
